Title: E-human resource management (E-HRM) project: A systematic literature review
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Authors with affiliations: Alexander, I., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Information Technology is the golden key in this era and it has changed how the way we live. One of the big impacts is in organizational process especially in Human Resource Management (HRM). With the help of Information Technology, it changed the way of t raditional HR into modern HR. One of the most popular technology for HRM is Electronic Human Resource Management (E-HRM). E-HRM is an application of information technology that allows managers, applicants and employees access to human resource related information and services through the Internet. In this study we focused to discuss the success factor of E-HRM project implementation and the challenge of implementing E-HRM project. The successful E-HRM implementation can be achieved if there are a support from top management and many factors. However, there are still many challenges for implementing E-HRM. With this kind of factor and challenge, organization must know what to do before implementing the E-HRM system. © 2020, International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: EHRM; Electronic Human Resource Management; Human Resource Management; Information Technology

Authors: Susanto R., Oktavianus W., Prayogo W., Budijono S., Wijaya R.
Title: Wearable Device for Restaurant Operational that Employs People with Hearing Impairment
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Oktavianus, W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prayogo, W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Speed in serving consumers is one of the top priorities in restaurants. To provide fast and precise service, it needed a device that is able to help the operational system at restaurant. This research focus on creating a device that can help operational system at restaurant that can be controlled using the smartphone. The device is designed to combine several components that were merged into a wearable device. The result is wearable devices that can last 7 hours 34 minutes with 2 hours charging time, average operating distance 35.3 m, and 5% error glitch. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Audition; Charging time; Android; Firebase; Hearing impairments; Operational systems; Research focus; Restaurant; Wearable devices; Wearable technology

Authors: Wijaya R., Christian V., Yuwananda Y.S., Alexander I.
Title: Temperature and humidity monitoring system in server room using raspberry Pi
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Authors with affiliations: Wijaya, R., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Christian, V., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Yuwananda, Y.S., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Alexander, I., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Server is a vital device and should be given more attention in active state. Important data like database or documents of web application are stored in server. The server must active for a long time and doing a heavy process, if the room temperature is not conducive it can cause a decrease of server performance. Because of this problem we proposed a monitoring system that can be used a solution for this problem. In this research we create a monitoring system using Raspberry Pi and DHT11 sensor. The results obtained that the temperature data received by the sensor are successfully sent and stored into a database using Raspberry Pi, the accuracy results of the DHT11 sensor used is 98.15% and the system successfully sent an e-mail notification when the temperature data received from the sensor passed the normal limit (20°C-25°C). © IJSTR 2019.
Author Keywords: Humidity sensor; Internet; Monitoring; MySQL database; Raspyberry Pi; Server; Temperature sensor
References: Nawale, B., Allurwar, N., Temperature/Humidity Monitoring Webserver (2016) Int. J. Eng. Tech. Authors: Niro L., Hermawan A., Wijaya R., Lie Z.S., Hedwig R.
Title: Smart bed and battery driven auto warm bolster based on Raspberry Pi and Arduino
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Niro, L., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hermawan, A., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lie, Z.S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Sleep quality is one of the main issues related to health and this research aims to assist an individual in obtaining better sleep quality by developing a smart bed that can provide comfort according to the user's needs. The smart bed is able to identify the user and adjust its comfort settings according to the user's needs by using a fingerprint sensor and Arduino as the input-output controller. Raspberry Pi was used to control the whole system that comes in the form of smart module that can be assembled and customized in any type of bed, old or new. The smart bed was tested by 10 users and gained an 83% satisfaction rate. As an addition to the smart bed, a battery driven auto warm bolster was assembled as part of bed accessories that can maintain its temperature at 32°C to provide a comfortable level of warmth for the user. © 2019 Internetworking Indonesia.
Author Keywords: Arduino; Finger print sensor; Smart bed; Smart bolster; Smart home

Authors: Manuel C., Avila J., Budiman L., Wijaya R., Hedwig R.
Title: Customizable smart food cabinet and refrigerator
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Science and Technology
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Manuel, C., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Avila, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiman, L., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, 9 K.H. Syahdan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This smart appliances project is intended to create home appliances which are able interconnect one another and share data to provide convenient and comfortable environment to users. For this project, we successfully developed a smart food cabinet with the abilities to perform several things such as giving information about the items stored within the smart food cabinet to its users via a mobile application. By using the information, the users contact the store to order the items needed. The food cabinet takes the data from the smart cabinet about the items and combine them to its own data to give information about recipes selection according to the availability of the items in both smart food cabinet and refrigerator. The system is built based on Arduino and Raspberry Pi, and the results shows that the recipes displayed in the LCD are according the availability of the items. The information can be accessed via Android based application in a smartphone. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Data sharing; Smart appliances; Smart cabinet; Smart home; Smart refrigerator
Funding Text 1: This work was partially supported by Research Grant from Ministry of Research Technology and Higher Education of Republic of Indonesia under contract number 0422/K3/KM/2017 on May 24, 2017 between KOPERTIS III and Bina Nusantara University.

Authors: Susanto R., Wijaya R., Talok A., Hartono J.R., Hedwig R., Lukas J., Dewanto S.
Title: Stabilizing system for quadrotor copter like flying robot by using proportional-integral-derivative (PID) controller
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Talok, A., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hartono, J.R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lukas, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dewanto, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this research, a quardrotor copter like a flying robot is developed with its capability to stabilize itself during the steady flying in a determined position. In order to gain its stability, intentionally a simple filter with a low error rate of 1.67% during its full operation was placed. The time consumed during its steady flying in the air took approximately one second with the height of flying around 1 to 5 meters above the earth. © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: copter like; filter; flying robot; proportional integral derivative controller; quardrotor
Index Keywords: Robots; Two term control systems; copter like; filter; Flying robots; Proportional integral derivative controllers; quardrotor; Proportional control systems

Title: Implementing eco friendly highly reliable upload feature using multi 3G service
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tanutama, L., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The current trend of eco friendly Internet access is preferred. In this research the understanding of eco friendly is minimum power consumption. The devices that are selected have operationally low power consumption and normally have no power consumption as they are hibernating during idle state. To have the reliability a router of a router that has internal load balancing feature will provide the improvement of previous research on multi 3G services for broadband lines. Previous studies emphasized on accessing and downloading information files from Public Cloud residing Web Servers. The demand is not only for speed but high reliability of access as well. High reliability will mean mitigating both direct and indirect high cost due to repeated attempts of uploading and downloading the large files. Nomadic and mobile computer users need viable solution. Following solution for downloading information has been proposed and tested. The solution is promising. The result is now extended to providing reliable access line by means of redundancy and automatic reconfiguration for uploading and downloading large information files to a Web Server in the Cloud. The technique is taking advantage of internal load balancing feature to provision a redundant line acting as a backup line. A router that has the ability to provide load balancing to several WAN lines is chosen. The WAN lines are constructed using multiple 3G lines. The router supports the accessing Internet with more than one 3G access line which increases the reliability and availability of the Internet access as the second line immediately takes over if the first line is disturbed. © 2017 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Electric power supplies to apparatus; Electric power utilization; Environmental protection; Redundancy; Reliability; Telecommunication lines; Web services; 3G services; Automatic reconfiguration; High reliability; Information files; Low-power consumption; Mobile computers; Reliability and availability; Viable solutions; Electronic document exchange

Authors: Tanutama L., Wijaya R., Zakaria H., Dasandra A.
Title: Multi 3G service for broadband line
Source title: Proceedings - 2016 6th International Annual Engineering Seminar, InAES 2016
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tanutama, L., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Zakaria, H., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Dasandra, A., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Considering that the current information content being exchanged is increasingly multimedia, it is quite natural to the demand for a relatively short time downloading or to a certain extent uploading large information files to the Internet. Mobility is increasingly demanded along with broadband. Certain to locations do not have the necessary infrastructure for broadband. Users that are residing in fixed locations will be able to access broadband service. They could access high-speed access line and enjoy for broadband services offered by service providers. The operators provide both conventional copper cables and fiber optic cables as access lines. Sometimes it is not possible for users that are nomadic or mobile to obtain broadband access line. Quite often small and medium-sized companies need to have an alternative solution to access broadband lines that are economic and technically simple. In the mean time, cellular service providers offer 3G Internet services with nationwide coverage to access the Internet. 3G service has reasonably high transmission speed. We had performed a similar research but changes in the platform and algorithm in the router challenged us to ensure sustainability of the concept. This research still develops an application that uses multi 3G services to provide broadband access. The solution that is being developed should sustain its economic nature and simplicity. Using available multiple 3G connections, a user can access large files of information through virtual high speed channel anytime and any where. A technique of paralleling multiple lower speed channels to obtain a virtual high-speed channel is called inverse multiplexing. To simplify the technique a router that has the ability to provide load balancing to several WAN lines is chosen. The inverse multiplexing concept through a number of channels with 3G services can run well for downloading files from a Web Server as shown by laboratory experiments and field measurements. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Cables; Internet service providers; Multiplexing; Multiplexing equipment; Resource allocation; Speed; Technical presentations; Telecommunication lines; Web services; Alternative solutions; High transmission; High-speed access lines; High-speed channels; Information contents; Inverse multiplexing; Laboratory experiments; Small and medium-sized companies; Electronic document exchange

Authors: Tanutama L., Wijaya R., Alexander K., Wiratama A., Indraswara R.
Title: A Novel Broadband Line Construction Using 3G Service
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Computer Engineering, Jl.KH. Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tanutama, L., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Engineering, Jl.KH. Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Engineering, Jl.KH. Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alexander, K., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Engineering, Jl.KH. Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wiratama, A., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Engineering, Jl.KH. Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Indraswara, R., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Engineering, Jl.KH. Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Quite often, it is necessary to upload or download large files in a relatively short time and from or to locations that do not necessarily have adequate infrastructure. If the location is static the needs can be addressed easily. There are high-speed transmission or broadband services offered by a large number of operators through both conventional and fiber optic cables. If the users are moving nomadically or are mobile, then obtaining large-capacity transmission systems is not simple. For some purposes, especially for small and medium-sized companies, they need to have alternative solutions that are economic and technically feasible. Cellular service providers offer 3G Internet services with wide coverage. This study develops an application using 3G services to provide broadband access that is economic and relatively simple. This solution uses multiple 3G connection to transmit information at high speed as if there is broadband channel capacity. Information on a Web Server can be downloaded by the parties concerned. The information retrieval can obtain the necessary capacity using multiple 3G connections. The technique of bundling multiple lower speed channels to obtain high-speed channel is called inverse multiplexing. In this research, the technique is simplified by using a router that has the ability to provide load balancing. This research was carried out by conducting laboratory experiments and field measurements. The experimental results show that the concept of inverse multiplexing through a number of channels with 3G services can run well for downloading files. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Broadband networks; Internet; Multiplexing; Multiplexing equipment; Network management; 3G; Capacity transmission; High speed transmission; Inverse multiplexing; Laboratory experiments; Mangler; NHT; Small and medium-sized companies; Web services

Authors: Wijaya R., Kerta J.M., Hedwig R.
Title: Influences of wireless traffic toward wifiperformance at BINUS square - Jakarta
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara Foundation, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kerta, J.M., Bina Nusantara Foundation, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: BINUS Square is a dormitory for students of Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta which provides Internet facility with wireless media. Since 2010, there have been many complaints on network performance such as slow connections or frequent break up of connections. Although the configuration and network capacity has been regularly fixed and upgraded, the complaints keep on repeating. The current study is formulated by using multiple case methodologies such as data retrieval by using SNMP polling tools, Access Point (AP) Monitoring, Syslog, and field measurements. It is noted that the distance factor, the number of users and signal strength do not influence the speed with an average of 4,769 Kbps for download and 874 Kbps for upload. However the roaming activity occurring in WLAN is equal to 30% of 10,418 roaming events, which in turn lead to the slow speed of the connections. © 2013 IIJ.
Author Keywords: Access point monitoring; Network analyzer; Snmp polling; Syslog; Wireless traffic
References: Lockwood, J.W., "Implementation of Campus-Wide Wireless Network Services Using ATM, virtual LANs, and Wireless Basestation" (1999) Proceeding of IEEE Wireless Communications and Networking Conference (WCNC 1999), 2, pp. 603-605; Hills, A., Wireless Andrew [mobile computing for university campus]" (1999) IEEE Spectrum, 36 (6), pp. 49-53; Zhiwen, Y., Yunji, L., Bukan, X., Yue, Y., Bin, G., "Towards a Smart Campus with Mobile Social Networking" (2011), pp. 162-169. , Proceeding of International Conference on Internet of Things (iThings/CPSCom) and 4th International Conference on Cyber, Physical and Social Computing; Papadopouli, M., Haipeng, S., Raftopoulos, E., Ploumidis, M., Hernandez-Campus, F., "Short-Term Forecasting in a Campus-Wide Wireless Network" (2005) Proceeding of IEEE 16th International Symposium on Personal, Indoor and Mobile Radio Communications (PIMRC 2005), 3, pp. 1446-1452; Schwab, D., Bunt, R., "Characterising the Use of a Campus Wireless Network" (2004) Proceeding of 23rd Annual/Joint Conference of the IEEE Computer and Communications Societies (INFOCOM 2004), 2, pp. 862-870; Kortz, D., Essien, K., "Analysis of a Campus-Wide Wireless Network" (2005) J.
